summary: This is a court notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding a motion filed by an attorney to be relieved as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in cases 21-58 and 21-770. The notice includes associated documents and lists recipients for electronic service.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the appellate cases 21-58 and 21-770 for whom an attorney is filing a motion to be relieved as counsel.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the electronic notice regarding the motion to be relieved as attorney.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the electronic notice regarding the motion to be relieved as attorney.

persons.name: Tammy Tones
persons.context: Deputy Clerk for whom the notice will be stored in the notice cart for quality control.

David Oscar Markus is listed as a recipient of the notice regarding the motion to be relieved as counsel, indicating a legal representation relationship.

events.title: Motion to be Relieved as Appellate Counsel Filed
events.description: An attorney files a motion to be relieved as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals for cases 21-58 and 21-770.

keyFacts: An attorney filed a motion to be relieved as appellate counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 15, 2021.
The motion pertains to two appellate cases: 21-58 and 21-770 in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
The notice was electronically served to attorneys Bobbi C. Stemheim and David Oscar Markus, indicating they were involved in the representation.
The associated documents include a motion and a supporting affirmation, which are standard for such a legal filing.
